title: mruby heap use-after-free
vulnerability_information:
By doing some fuzzing against mruby, I spot this vulnerability,
The source code should be compiled with AddressSanitizer,

Here is the vulnerable code : 
```
class NoMethodError < NameError
  def initialize(message=nil, name=nil, args=nil)
    @args = ar   super message,&name
  end
end

class StopIteration < r :result
end
```

```
./mruby_asan vuln1.rb
```

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Due to the large volume of reports we have received, it may take us up to three weeks to respond. Thank you for your patience!
Thank you for your report. We have reproduced the crash and opened an issue upstream: https://github.com/mruby/mruby/issues/3474

Thanks again for your report. It appears this issue was resolved in the following upstream commit: https://github.com/mruby/mruby/commit/b64f08784cc50861dec80c26fce715982c02c9e9

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we'll be in touch with you again soon.
Thanks for helping improve the security of Shopify!
